Sentence.sentence: They may have trouble getting adequate food.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They are more likely to grow up in neighborhoods that their parents say aren't great for raising children, and their parents worry about them getting shot, beaten up or in trouble with the law.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: However, it's clear that Macy's believes its troubles run deeper than a temporary aberration ( ' , 偏离) off the thermometer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is also troubling that voting rates among our youngest eligible voters—18- to 24-year-olds—are way down: Little more than one in four now go to the polls, even in national elections, compared with almost twice that many when 18-year-olds were first given the vote.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Now, a new study that began with about 1,000 children in New Zealand has tracked how a child’s low self-control can predict poor health, money troubles and even a criminal record in their adult years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Teenagers at risk of depression, anxiety and suicide often wear their troubles like a neon ( ' ,  霓虹灯 ) sign.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It provides new early-warning signals for identifying teens in trouble.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For all their troubles, the United States’ 3,500 institutions were flooded with more than half a million students from 193 countries last year.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But at a time when the American factory seems to be a shrinking presence, and when good manufacturing jobs have vanished, perhaps never to return, there is something deeply troubling about this dilution of American craftsmanship.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He felt troubled about the weakening of American craftsmanship.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Well, the suppliers have got some trouble or other.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Her troubles have brought her closer to her family.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I have enough trouble delivering bikes to shops only forty miles away, never mind five thousand miles.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Machines also had difficulty adjusting for people who look a lot alike—either doppelgangers, whom the machine would have trouble identifying as two separate people, or the same person who appeared in different photos at different ages or in different ligh
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Many firms operating brick and mortar stores are in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The trouble is, for many of the researchers who'd like to design systems to address these challenges, massive datasets for experimentation just don't exist—at least, not in formats that are accessible to academic researchers.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使人不安或烦恼"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bother, disturb, trouble, annoy, irritate, vex
means: bother ： 指使人烦恼而引起的紧张不安或感到不耐烦。
disturb ： 较正式用词，多用被动态。指拢乱，使人不能平静或妨碍别人工作、思维或正常秩序，是程度较深的烦恼。
trouble ： 指给人在行动上带来不便或在身心上造成痛苦。
annoy ： 强调因被迫忍受令人不快、讨厌的事而失去平静或耐心，多指一时的打拢或恼怒。
irritate ： 语气比annoy强得多，指激怒，使发怒，多指一种短时间的反应。
vex ： 侧重指因不断的干扰而引起的烦恼，有时含激怒的意味。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均表示"努力"之意。
means: effort ： 通常指完成某特定任务所需付出的或大或小的努力，可指一次的努力，也可指坚持不懈的努力。
trouble和pains均侧重在面临困难或阻力时所作的努力，但强调在努力时的细心和谨慎，相比之下，pains更适合表示尽力的努力。
endeavour ： 指持久的，坚持不懈的，甚至是终身的努力，强调努力的认真与决心。
struggle ： 指为克服困难或阻力所作的努力，也指因决心、意志或干劲而产生的极大努力。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 麻烦的, 讨厌的, 棘手的
stems_affixes.word_buile: trouble烦恼+some表形容词→adj.麻烦的, 讨厌的, 棘手的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 烦恼, 麻烦, 动乱
stems_affixes.word_buile: troub搅动,混乱+le表示反复动作→n.&v.烦恼, 麻烦, 动乱

Sentence.sentence: Back home, Ehlers was troubled by that lost dog.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: But Lehanne's psychology café is about more than knowing oneself: It's trying to help the city's troubled neighborhood cafes.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But the next time you find yourself among strangers, consider that small talk is worth the trouble.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: He had a strong desire to free her family from trouble.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: He is a good/devoted/caring/loving father because he was strict with his daughter and encouraged her when she was in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 答案 选项

Sentence.sentence: He reported the case to the police and then sat there, lost and lonely in strange city, thinking of the terrible troubles of getting all the paperwork organized again.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: I learned through another woman's eyes that my daughter was still a good person despite her troubled teenage years.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 完形填空 A 原文

Sentence.sentence: I realized one kayak was in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I tried to convince myself that the trouble was with the problem itself, not with me.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: In the 1960s,while studying the volcanic history of Yellowstone national park,bob christiansen became puzzled about something that,oddly,had not troubled anyone before：he couldn't find the park's volcano.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: It might have saved me some trouble had I known the schedule.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It was when we were returning home that I realized what a good feeling it was to have helped someone in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 单项选择 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many people are working hard to preserve these ponies, and trying to come up with plans to find a sustainable future for one of dartmoor's most financially-troubled elements.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Much time spent sitting at a desk, office workers are generally troubled by health problems.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Mum and I became mad with him for placing our family in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: My trip to the repair shop cost me $62, and the sit is working well now, but I keep expecting more trouble.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Second, if other factors such as technology remain constant, economic growth and material expectations will fall well below recent standards and this could invite trouble.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 任务型阅读 原文

Sentence.sentence: She was afraid the dog would get the family into trouble.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: Suppose you're in a rush, felling tired, not paying attention to your screen, and you send an email that could get you in trouble.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The man is having trouble deciding what to eat.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 听力 选项

Sentence.sentence: They were troubled by disagreement among family members.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

Sentence.sentence: Usually, gossip spreads information about a topic-breakups, trouble at home, even dropping out-that a person would rather keep secret.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: We learn that however much we try to please, some people are never going to love us-an idea that troubles at first but is eventually relaxing.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Bankers have been blaming themselves for their troubles in public.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: An old saying has it that half of all advertising budgets are wasted-the trouble is, no one knows which half.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Mental health allows us to view others with sympathy if they are having troubles ,with kindness if they are in pain,and with unconditional love no matter who they are.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Previous studies on CSR have had trouble differentiating these effects because consumers can be affected by all three.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But at least they have demonstrated that when companies get into trouble with the law, evidence of good character can win them less costly punishment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

means.word_mean: 困难, 忧虑, 麻烦

sentences.en: The old lady told me all her troubles.
sentences.cn: 这个老太太把她的烦恼都告诉了我。

sentences.en: He has been through much trouble.
sentences.cn: 他已渡过许多困难。

sentences.en: The new company did well at first, but then ran into trouble.
sentences.cn: 这家新公司最初办得还不错, 但后来就陷入困境了。

sentences.en: The trouble is that he doesn't have enough money.
sentences.cn: 麻烦在于他缺钱。

sentences.en: She had no hand in this trouble.
sentences.cn: 她没有参与这次纠纷。

sentences.en: The car's got some sort of engine trouble again.
sentences.cn: 车子的引擎又出了什么故障。

sentences.en: I mustn't trouble if he doesn't come tonight.
sentences.cn: 今晚他若不来, 我就不用费心劳神了。

sentences.en: Please don't trouble to see me off at the station.
sentences.cn: 请不用麻烦到车站送我了。

sentences.en: I don't wish to trouble them.
sentences.cn: 我不愿意去麻烦他们。

sentences.en: What troubles me is that the supply of raw materials is not ensured.
sentences.cn: 使我担忧的是原料供应没有保证。

sentences.en: May I trouble you to shut the door?
sentences.cn: 麻烦你把门关上好吗?</seg>

sentence.cn: 她担心那只狗会使家庭陷入困境。
sentence.en: She was afraid the dog would get the family into trouble.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

sentence.cn: 我通过另一个女人的眼睛了解到，尽管我女儿少年时代十分困扰，但她仍然是一个好人。
sentence.en: I learned through another woman’s eyes that my daughter was still a good person despite her troubled teenage years.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 完形填空 A 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)act in a way that is likely to incur problems or difficulties

lj.lj_ly: hitching a lift is asking for trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 想免费搭便车是自找麻烦。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)behave in a way that is likely to provoke an argument or fight

lj.lj_ly: youths take a cocktail of drink and drugs before going out to look for trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 酒和毒品混用过以后，这群年轻人就出去惹是生非了。

phrase.cizu_name: a trouble shared is a trouble halved

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)talking to someone else about one's problems helps to alleviate them
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)苦恼让人知晓，负担一半减少

entry.def: You can refer to problems or difficulties as trouble .

example.ex: I had trouble parking...
example.tran: 我停车有困难。

example.ex: You've caused us a lot of trouble...
example.tran: 你给我们造成了很多麻烦。

entry.def: If you say that one aspect of a situation is the trouble, you mean that it is the aspect which is causing problems or making the situation unsatisfactory.
entry.tran: 麻烦;问题;引起麻烦的事

example.ex: The trouble is that these restrictions have remained while other things have changed...
example.tran: 问题是其他事情都变了，而这些条条框框还在。

example.ex: Your trouble is that you can't take rejection.
example.tran: 你的问题是不能接受拒绝。

entry.def: Your troubles are the things that you are worried about.

example.ex: She tells me her troubles. I tell her mine…
example.tran: 我和她互相倾诉烦恼。

example.ex: She kept her troubles to herself.
example.tran: 她把烦心事都放在心里。

entry.def: If you have kidney trouble or back trouble, for example, there is something wrong with your kidneys or your back.

example.ex: An unsuitable bed is the most likely cause of back trouble…
example.tran: 不合适的床最有可能引起背部疼痛。

example.ex: Her husband had never before had any heart trouble...
example.tran: 她丈夫以前从来没得过任何心脏疾病。

entry.def: If there is trouble somewhere, especially in a public place, there is fighting or rioting there.

example.ex: Riot police are being deployed throughout the city to prevent any trouble...
example.tran: 正在全城部署防暴警察以防止发生骚乱。

example.ex: Fans who make trouble during the World Cup will be severely dealt with.
example.tran: 在世界杯期间闹事的球迷将受到严惩。

entry.def: If you tell someone that it is no trouble to do something for them, you are saying politely that you can or will do it, because it is easy or convenient for you.

example.ex: It's no trouble at all; on the contrary, it will be a great pleasure to help you...
example.tran: 根本不费事，恰恰相反，非常荣幸能帮到你。

example.ex: Will it be any trouble to get over here that quickly?
example.tran: 那么快来这里会不会有什么不便？

entry.def: If you say that a person or animal is no trouble, you mean that they are very easy to look after.
entry.tran: 需劳神费力的人(或动物)

example.ex: My little grandson is no trouble at all, but his 6-year-old elder sister is rude and selfish.
example.tran: 我的小孙子一点都不让人操心，但是他6岁大的姐姐却野蛮而又自私。

entry.def: If something troubles you, it makes you feel rather worried.

example.ex: Is anything troubling you?...
example.tran: 有什么事情让你烦恼吗？

example.ex: He was troubled by the lifestyle of his son.
example.tran: 他对儿子的生活方式感到很担心。

entry.def: If a part of your body troubles you, it causes you physical pain or discomfort.

example.ex: The ulcer had been troubling her for several years.
example.tran: 溃疡已经折磨她好几年了。

entry.def: If you say that someone does not trouble to do something, you are critical of them because they do not behave in the way that they should do, and you think that this would require very little effort.

example.ex: He yawns, not troubling to cover his mouth...
example.tran: 他打了个哈欠，都懒得抬抬手遮一下嘴巴。

example.ex: He hadn't troubled himself to check his mirrors...
example.tran: 他都没想要看看后视镜。

entry.def: You use trouble in expressions such as I'm sorry to trouble you when you are apologizing to someone for disturbing them in order to ask them something.

example.ex: I'm sorry to trouble you, but I wondered if by any chance you know where he is...
example.tran: 对不起打扰了，但我想打听一下您是否知道他在哪里。

example.ex: I hate to trouble you, but Aunt Lina's birthday is coming up and I would like to buy something nice for her.
example.tran: 我真不愿打扰您，但莉娜阿姨的生日就要到了，我想给她买点好东西。

entry.def: If someone is in trouble, they are in a situation in which a person in authority is angry with them or is likely to punish them because they have done something wrong.
entry.tran: 处于困境;惹麻烦;将受惩罚

example.ex: He was in trouble with his teachers...
example.tran: 老师们都想好好教训他。

example.ex: The person who loaned them to me got into terrible trouble for it.
example.tran: 把那笔钱借给我的那个人因此倒霉了。

entry.def: If you take the trouble to do something, you do something which requires a small amount of additional effort.

example.ex: It is worth taking the trouble to sieve the fruit by hand…
example.tran: 值得费点劲用手挑挑果子。

example.ex: He did not take the trouble to see the film before he attacked it.
example.tran: 他在批评那部电影之前都懒得费神欣赏。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is more trouble than they are worth, you mean that they cause you a lot of problems or take a lot of time and effort and you do not achieve or gain very much in return.

example.ex: Some grumbled that Johnson was more trouble than he was worth...
example.tran: 有人抱怨说根本不值得为约翰逊浪费精力。

example.ex: Learning more about it always seemed more trouble than it was worth.
example.tran: 似乎总是觉得没必要为进一步了解它而大费工夫。

sentences.sentence: "one trouble after another delayed the job"
"he didn't want to make a fuss"

means.word_mean: 3. an event causing distress or pain;

sentences.sentence: "I went to a lot of trouble"
"finished the test only with great difficulty"
"his worry over the prospect of being fired"
"it is not work but worry that kills"
"he wanted to die and end his troubles"

means.word_mean: 2. to cause inconvenience or discomfort to;
3. disturb in mind or make uneasy or cause to be worried or alarmed;

sentences.sentence: "She was rather perturbed by the news that her father was seriously ill"

means.word_mean: 4. take the trouble to do something; concern oneself;

sentences.sentence: "He did not trouble to call his mother on her birthday"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French truble (noun), trubler (verb), based on Latin turbidus (see turbid)

sentences.cn: 唯一的麻烦是到那时我们就不在这儿了。

sentences.cn: 我们的麻烦还没有完呢。
sentences.en: Our troubles aren't over yet.

sentences.cn: 我不想给你添很多的麻烦。
sentences.en: I don't want to put you to a lot of trouble .

sentences.en: Making your own yogurt is more trouble than it's worth .

sentences.cn: 她从不把麻烦当回事。
sentences.en: Nothing is ever too much trouble for her (= she's always ready to help) .

sentences.cn: 我们外出时孩子们一点儿也没给我添麻烦。
sentences.en: The children didn't give me any trouble at all when we were out.

sentences.en: She didn't even take the trouble to find out how to spell my name.

sentences.en: You've caused us a lot of trouble...

sentences.en: If I could take your troubles, I would toss them into the sea.

sentences.cn: 相当多的企业都遇到过关于公司和产品的突然要改名的烦恼.

sentences.en: The old lady told me all her troubles.

sentences.cn: 去好好休息一下, 你也许能以睡眠消除烦恼.
sentences.en: Go and have a good rest; you might be able to sleep your troubles away.

sentences.cn: 悲哀和烦恼不是使人心软,就是使人心狠.
sentences.en: Sorrow and trouble either soften the heart or harden it.

sentences.en: You left all your troubles behind for a few days of vacation in a new place.

sentences.cn: 突然一股来自家庭生活的幸福感席遍我的全身,所有的烦恼也都迅速地消失了.
sentences.en: A fleeting sensation of domestic happiness passes over me and all my troubles vanish quickly.

sentences.cn: 只要几年工夫, 我就会被烦恼和穷困弄得面容瘦削, 憔悴不堪.
sentences.en: In a few years I should be pinched, thin , and haggard, beset with troubles and miseries.

sentences.cn: 人世间的大多数烦恼都是由那些想成为重要人物的人惹出来的.
sentences.en: Most of the trouble in the world is caused by people wanting to be important.

sentences.cn: 我想得到简单的生活,结束掉所有的烦恼.

Sentence.sentence: He's always trying to make trouble.

Sentence.sentence: However, the business had been in trouble for years.

Sentence.sentence: Students are more likely to think about their actions and see whether they will lead to trouble.

Sentence.sentence: That people often experience trouble sleeping in a different bed in unfamiliar surroundings is a phenomenon known as the "first-night" effect.
